snippet: After peace talks with the United States broke down in Doha, eight or more relatively high-ranking Taliban officials remained there without a mission.
abstract: Taliban peace delegation of eight or more relatively high-ranking officials remains at loose ends in Doha, Qatar, after peace talks with United States broke down in early 2012; negotiations are unlikely to start anytime soon, as new fighting season in Afghanistan is off to particularly violent start and latest push to restart talks is all but abandoned.

byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin and Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: After peace talks with the United States broke down in Doha, eight or more relatively high-ranking Taliban officials remained there without a mission.

headline.seo: Taliban Peace Envoys in Qatar With Nothing to Do
headline.main: Peace Envoys From Taliban at Loose Ends in Qatar
headline.print_headline: Peace Envoys From Taliban At Loose Ends
